intro: Xanthisma junceum, commonly known as the golden grass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low rainfall and high temperatures. Xanthisma junceum is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
